name: Dried Apricot Mousse
keywords: apple, apricot, dry white wine, dessert, high fiber, winter

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer the apricots in the wine with the apples, lemon juice and sugar, covered, for 15 to 20 minutes or until soft. Cool and puree in a food processor.
Meanwhile, beat the egg whites until they are in stiff peaks. Using a whisk, fold them into the apricot puree.
Spoon the mousse into eight wine glasses or individual bowls. Chill for one to two hours. Just before serving, sprinkle with almonds.
